poem:
The Unseen Stage

In the mist of Scottish morn,  
a stage whispers its decay—  
an orchestra of silence playing  
to an empty hall.  
Here, the ghosts of actors linger  
as the velvet curtain trembles,  
fearing its own final fall,  
a slow unraveling of dreams  
in a world grown deaf  
to the echoes of art.
